Comments_Questions: How clearly did the instructor define the topic of study
How clearly did the instructor outline the expectation for the course, classroom activity and homework
How well were individual class sessions prepared and presented
How well did lectures fit within the boundaries of the course
How available was the instructor for help outside the classroom
How useful were assignments in furthering an understanding of the topic
If tests were given, how fairly did they measure knowledge gained?
How useful was this course in preparing you for production work
How would you evaluate the instructor's knowledge of the material
Please offer additional comments on such topics as: what worked best about the course, suggested improvements, class materials, etc.
Comments_List: Literally wrote the book on the subject
Working through problems on the board was very essential in my learning process, thank you.
Making a subject that is so clearly well understood, and frequently taught, seem interesting and exciting is truly exceptional.

I'd be okay with another homework assignment. Essentially just more worked through examples to be able to go back to in the future would be great; though I guess the book is for that, but there is something to it actually being a problem you worked on for memories sake.

I'm not entirely sure if I grasped the concepts quickly, or if the workload was light. I expected homework to be much more difficult than it was.

I know it's impossible, but I would have appreciated more hands-on work, and less theoretical math. Physical examples of power formulas, that sort of thing.
As with Automation, maybe more work wouldn't have hurt.
Well he never leaves his classroom, so
You're always in B1 for questions.
Whenever something was confusing, I could just ask you about it.

Somewhere between 3 and 4 I think. I definitely can't spew things back off the top of my head, but I at least know what I know and don't know and have a much better understanding of what book or how to search for something online when I'm trying to figure it out.
It's hard to fail a test when it's open book...
While the content in this course isn't necessarily my strongpoint, I feel confident I have at least a common vocabulary for those that are well versed in stage machinery
I love that this class is at this point in our 3 years and not any later.
I look forward to using this information on my future shows! Looking forward to designing some automation systems!
I love the all of the handouts. I keep each course handouts divided in the same binder, and they have already proved to be a tremendous resource.

On the board examples and working through homework problems was the best for me. Though working through the homework with the answers at the bottom was key. 

I was sort of indifferent about the tests, though it was just another way to learn and see what I may not have actually understood.
